summary: The 'Let Experienced Pilots Fly Act of 2025' amends U.S. law to raise the mandatory retirement age for pilots engaged in commercial aviation operations. The bill sets the retirement age at 67, modifying existing regulations in Title 49 and Title 14 of the United States Code. It also includes provisions for compliance, amendments to labor agreements and benefit plans, medical standards, and safety training. Furthermore, the FAA Administrator is tasked with submitting a report within 180 days on further increasing the age limitation.
